newsitem.title: USA: Launch of Saudi MTBE plant delayed to mid June.
newsitem.headline: Launch of Saudi MTBE plant delayed to mid June.

text.p: Saudi Petrochemical Co (Sadaf) again delayed the launch of its new 700,000 tonne-per-year methyl tertiary butyl ether (MTBE) plant in Al Jubail until mid June, a source close to the company said late Monday.
"The start up has been delayed to about middle of June because of some technical problems," said the source.

The new 16,000 barrel per day (bpd) plant, which will raise Saudi Arabia's annual MTBE output to 2.6 million tonnes or about 60,000 bpd, was most recently scheduled to begin production at the end of May, sources have said.
Indeed, the delay is the latest in a string for the plant, which has been beset by unspecified technical problems. The plant was originally set to go on line in February, the industry sources said.
Sadaf is a joint venture between Saudi Basic Industries Corp (SABIC) and Shell Oil Co, with each partner owning a 50 percent stake.
Shell declined to say what percentage of the gasoline additive is scheduled to be marketed in the U.S. but industry players have pegged the amount at about 70 percent.
The plant is the first privately-owned petrochemical facility in oil-rich Saudi Arabia.
MTBE is an additive which helps gasoline burn more cleanly.
